content: rolled edge raglan baby sweater by joan neumiller a very simple comfortable and cute pullover with a bonus no purling and no seams fits age newborn/ 3 months/ 6 months/ 1 year chest measurement 17 inches/ 19 inches/ 21 inches/ 23 inches finished length 9 5 inches/ 10 5 inches/ 11 5 inches/ 12 5 inches increase rolled edges gauge 5 stitches = 1 inch yarn 275/ 300/ 325/ 350 yds crystal palace cotton twirl or other worsted weight needles size 7 knitting needles or size necessary to get gauge 1 set double pointed needles and one16 circular needle other materials 4 stitch markers 2 large and 4 small stitch holders or pieces of waste yarn and 1 yarn needle for grafting sewing underarm gaps and weaving in ends skills stockinette stitch knit 2 together knitting in the round increasing knitting with double pointed needles loose-edge bind off pattern sleeves if you knit a sleeve first you can use it instead of a swatch to check and adjust your gauge cast on co 18/ 22/ 26/ 30 stitches onto 3 or 4 double pointed needles dividing stitches evenly being careful not to twist the stitches join the ends by placing the end stitch from the left-hand needle onto the right-hand needle and placing the end stitch from the right-hand needle onto the left-hand needle place marker knit for 4 rounds on the 5th round make 1 m1 using a backwards loop or by knitting into the front and the back of the stitch before and after the marker knit 4 more rounds increasing as before on the 5th round and every 5th round afterwards until you have increased to 30/ 34/ 38/ 42 stitches continue knitting in the round until piece measures 4 5 / 5 5 / 6 5 / 7 5 remove marker and place all stitches on a stitch holder or piece of waste yarn knit 2nd sleeve the same as the first body co 82/ 90/ 98/ 106 stitches on circular needle being careful not to twist join the ends by placing the end stitch from the left-hand needle onto the right-hand needle and placing the end stitch from the right-hand needle onto the left-hand needle place marker knit in the round until piece measures 4 5 / 5 5 / 6 5 / 7 5 remove marker then knit 35/ 39/ 43/ 47 stitches this will be the front of the sweater place marker slip the next 6 stitches onto a stitch holder or piece of waste yarn slip the first sleeve onto the circular needle knitting across 24/ 28/ 32/ 36 stitches of the sleeve and placing the last 6 stitches onto a stitch holder or piece of waste yarn the held stitches from the body of the sweater and the sleeve should line up with each other place 2nd marker continue knitting the next 35/ 39/ 43/ 47 stitches of the body this will be the back of the sweater place 3rd marker
